main_question: In World War II, how did Canada contribute more to the Allied air effort than any other Commonwealth country?
question: In World War II, how did Canada contribute more to the Allied air effort than any other Commonwealth country?
possible_answers: D. Sent 130,000 soldiers to take France back from the Germans
explanatory_sentence: Canada contributed more to the Allied air effort than any other Commonwealth country by training over 130,000 Allied aircrew in Canada under the British Commonwealth Air Training Plan. The Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) also participated in the Battle of Britain and provided a high proportion of Commonwealth aircrew in bombers and fighter planes over Europe.
